subject: Chemistry
q: Which factor primarily determines the chemical reactivity of an element in a period?
options: Effective nuclear charge and valence electron configuration
exp: Reactivity across a period is governed by effective nuclear charge and valence electrons, affecting electron affinity/ionization.

subject: Chemistry
q: How many moles of water are produced when 1 moles of hydrogen gas react completely with oxygen? (2H2 + O2 → 2H2O)
exp: Reaction stoichiometry: 2 moles H2 produce 2 moles H2O, so moles of water equal moles of H2 reacted.

exp: Reactivity across a period is governed by effective nuclear charge and valence electrons, affecting electron affinity/ionization.

subject: Chemistry
q: Which factor primarily determines the chemical reactivity of an element in a period?
options: Effective nuclear charge and valence electron configuration
exp: Reactivity across a period is governed by effective nuclear charge and valence electrons, affecting electron affinity/ionization.

subject: Chemistry
q: How many moles of water are produced when 1 moles of hydrogen gas react completely with oxygen? (2H2 + O2 → 2H2O)
exp: Reaction stoichiometry: 2 moles H2 produce 2 moles H2O, so moles of water equal moles of H2 reacted.

subject: Chemistry

exp: Reaction stoichiometry: 2 moles H2 produce 2 moles H2O, so moles of water equal moles of H2 reacted.
